OpenStreetMap 在资料[元素](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Elements "Elements") (*点* [![Node](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/Mf_node.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/File:Mf_node.png "Node"), *路径* [![路径](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/Mf_way.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/File:Mf_way.png "路径") 或是 *关系* [![关系](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Mf_Relation.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/File:Mf_Relation.svg "关系"))。的标签（tags）使用上并无任何限制，你可以选用任何你想使用的标签。可是，如各OpenStreetMap用户在建议使用的设施标签（features）及相关标签作出共识，会对编辑地图起帮助。此条目列出了建议使用设施及相关标签。

如果你未能在此条目找到适当的标签，你可以前往[Proposed features](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Proposed_features "Proposed features")（拟议设施标签）。你可以在那里作出增加设施标签的建议。要将一群路径和点构成更高等及的组合，可疑查看[关系](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Relations "Relations")页面。

-   有关某些绘图要素的详细说明，请参见[要素索引](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Feature_Index "Feature Index")。
-   要提议一个新图标，请使用[提议的图标](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Proposed_Icons "Proposed Icons")页面。
-   要查看曾经有效但不应再使用的要素列表，请参阅[不推荐使用要素](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Deprecated_features "Deprecated features")。
-   [最近的地图要素更改](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Special:RecentChangesLinked/Category:Map_Features_template "Special:RecentChangesLinked/Category:Map Features template")
-   请参考[编辑标准和协定](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Editing_Standards_and_Conventions "Editing Standards and Conventions")

特别提醒：

-   使用这里所描述的标签代表你的编辑将会出现在*有可能*会出现在绘制出的地图上。但是这并不保证这里的所有标签都会被所有的绘图工具绘制在地图上。请参考[Symbol Rendering](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Symbol_Rendering "Symbol Rendering") 查看有哪些标签会被[Mapnik](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Mapnik "Mapnik") 和[Osmarender](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Osmarender "Osmarender") 绘制出来。
-   有许多会被绘制在地图上的标签并没有列在这里。这个列表并没有同步列出所有绘图工具所支持的标签。
-   '图上显示' 栏的图只是示意图，并不代表绘图工具一定会将这个标签的资料会制成这样子。

这些表按主题分组，按常用程度排序。

每个部分都是一个模板，可用于语言翻译。

### 公路

“highway” 是用于表示道路的标签，它往往是唯一的标记。在不同的国家或地区有相应的公约和使用方法，参见[公路标签用法](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Highway_tag_usage "Highway tag usage")和[公路](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Highways "Highways")。

Cyclist map[![Cyclist map-lane-right.png](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/Cyclist_map-lane-right.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/File:Cyclist_map-lane-right.png)

`opposite`

[![way](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_way.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Way "way")

Used on ways with `oneway=yes` where it is permitted to cycle in both directions.

Note - such streets are common in Belgium, the Netherlands and Denmark, for example, but are rare in the UK (although they do exist): often, instead, actually the street is two-way as normal for its whole length except for the very short section past the no-entry sign at the end, where cycles are excepted from the no-entry by means of a short lane separated by an island. This is called a "cycle plug". In some places this has been represented as very short oneway Way at the end with an adjacent cycleway, forming a little triangle with the road they join to, or sometimes with a short oneway Way with cycleway=opposite\_lane or opposite\_track.

### Waterway

This is used to described different types of waterways. When mapping the way of a river, stream, drain, canal, etc. these need to be aligned in the direction of the water flow. See the page titled **[Waterways](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Waterways "Waterways")** for an introduction on its usage.

### Aerialway

This is used to tag different forms of transportation for people or goods by using aerial wires. For example these may include cable-cars, chair-lifts and drag-lifts. See the page **[Aerialway](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Aerialway "Aerialway")** for more information on the usage of these tags.

### Tourism

This is used to map places and things of specific interest to tourists. For example these may be places to see, places to stay and things and places providing support. See the page titled **[Tourism](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Tourism "Tourism")** for an introduction on its usage.

An administrative boundary. Subdivisions of areas/territories/jurisdictions recognised by governments or other organisations for administrative purposes. These range from large groups of nation states right down to small administrative districts and suburbs, as indicated by the '`admin_level=*`' combo tag.

[![Rendering-adminlevel 2-mapnik.png](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/Rendering-adminlevel_2-mapnik.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/File:Rendering-adminlevel_2-mapnik.png)

[![Lake city sign.jpg](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/100px-Lake_city_sign.jpg)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/File:Lake_city_sign.jpg)

[maritime](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Tag:boundary%3Dmaritime "Tag:boundary=maritime")

[![area](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_area.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Area "area")

#### Attributes

[admin\_level](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:admin_level "Key:admin level")

*(number)*

[![area](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_area.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Area "area")

Applies to `boundary=administrative` and is usually in the range 1 to 10, except for several countries (Bolivia, Germany, Mozambique, Netherlands, Philippines, Poland, Turkmenistan, Venezuela) where it is in the range 1 to 11 – see [boundary](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:boundary "Key:boundary").

[border\_type](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:border_type "Key:border type")

\*

[![way](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_way.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Way "way") [![area](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_area.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Area "area")

To distinguish between types of boundary where admin\_level isn't enough. Used in several different ways e.g in maritime contexts.

[start\_date](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:start_date "Key:start date")

*(date)*

[![area](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_area.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Area "area")

Useful if the boundary is very recent (or if it will become effective in a near future).

### Sport

This is used to provide information about which sports are placed on a facility such as a pitch or stadium. It is intended to be used in conjunction with tags `landuse=*` or `leisure=*`. See the page titled **[Sport](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Sport "Sport")** for an introduction on its usage.

### Restrictions

This is used to define restrictions that apply to the associated element. See the page titled **[Restrictions](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Restrictions "Restrictions")** for an introduction on its usage.

Key

Value

Element

Comment

Rendering

Photo

Vehicle types

[access](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:access "Key:access")

agricultural / delivery / [designated](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Tag:access%3Ddesignated "Tag:access=designated") / destination / forestry / [no](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Tag:access%3Dno "Tag:access=no") / official / permissive / [private](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Tag:access%3Dprivate "Tag:access=private") / unknown / yes

[![way](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_way.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Way "way")

General access permission.

-   *agricultural* – Only for agricultural traffic
-   *delivery* – Only when delivering to the element.
-   *designated* – A preferred or designated route for a specific vehicle type or types. Not compulsory but often marked by a traffic sign
-   *destination* – Used for ways in designated local traffic areas, where traffic should only enter if its destination is within the area
-   *forestry* – Only for forestry traffic
-   *no* – No access for the general public. Consider using another tag indicating who can use the element
-   *official* – The way is dedicated to a specific mode of travel by law. Usually marked by traffic signs and exclusive. In Germany use is also compulsory. clarification needed
-   *permissive* – Open to general traffic until such time as the owner revokes the permission which they are legally allowed to do at any time in the future.
-   *private* – Only with permission of the owner on an individual basis
-   *unknown* – No information provided on access. This is the default value for most features with a general assumption that access is allowed for all purposes
-   *yes* – The public has an official, legal right of access, i.e. it's a right of way (default value)

`oneway=yes` for traffic direction same as the sequence of nodes of the way.
`oneway=no` for bidirectional traffic.
`oneway=-1` for traffic direction opposite to the sequence of nodes of the way (if the way cannot be reversed).
Some road types are assumed to be one-way (e.g. `highway=motorway`), others are assumed to be two-way (most others).

### Name

The name tag is the primary tag used for naming an Element. See the page titled **[Names](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Names "Names")** for an introduction on its usage.

Key

Value

Element

Comment

The common default name. (Notes:

-   For disputed areas, please use the name as displayed on, e.g., street signs for the name tag
-   Put all alternatives into either localized name tags (e.g., name:tr/name:el) or the variants (e.g., loc\_name/old\_name/alt\_name)
-   Do not abbreviate words: [Abbreviation don't do it](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Names#Abbreviation_.28don.27t_do_it.29 "Names"))

[![node](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_node.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Node "node") [![way](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_way.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Way "way") [![area](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_area.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Area "area")

should be a recognizable, commonly used short version of the name, not a nick name (use alt\_name for that), useful for searching (recognized by [Nominatim](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Nominatim "Nominatim")).

[sorting\_name](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:name "Key:name")

User defined

[![node](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_node.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Node "node") [![way](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_way.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Way "way") [![area](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_area.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Area "area")

name, used for correct sorting of names — This is only needed when sorting names cannot be based only on their orthography (using the Unicode Collation Algorithm with collation tables tailored by language and script, or when sorted lists of names are including names written in multiple languages and/or scripts) but requires ignoring some parts such as:

-   ignoring leading articles, or
-   lowering the relative importance of first names cited before a last name,
-   ignoring the generic part of a street name when it occurs before the specific name (e.g., in French with "rue", "boulevard", "place", etc.),

all of them being ignored at the primary sort level and not easily inferable by a preprocessing algorithm.

[alt\_name](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:alt_name "Key:alt name")

[![node](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_node.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Node "node") [![way](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_way.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Way "way") [![area](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_area.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Area "area")

Alternative name by which the feature is known. If there is a name that does not fit in any of the above keys, alt\_name can be used, e.g., `name=Field Fare Road` and `alt_name=Fieldfare Road`, or `name=University Centre` and `alt_name=Grad Pad`. In rare cases, the key is used for multiple semicolon-separated names, e.g. `alt_name=name1;name2;name3`, but this usage is not preferred.

~~[name\_1](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:name "Key:name")~~, ~~[name\_2](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:name "Key:name")~~, ...

Do not use this tag, suffixed name tagging for multiple values is [deprecated](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Proposed_features/Remove_suffixed_name-tags_from_wiki "Proposed features/Remove suffixed name-tags from wiki").

#### Tags for individual houses

[addr:housenumber](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:addr:housenumber "Key:addr:housenumber")

user defined

[![node](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_node.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Node "node") [![area](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_area.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Area "area")

The [house number](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_numbering "wikipedia:House numbering") (may contain letters, dashes or other characters).
 [Addresses](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Addresses "Addresses") describes ways to tag a single building with multiple addresses.
 Please do not only tag `addr:housenumber=*`, but also add at least `addr:street=*` or `addr:place=*` for [places without streets](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Addresses#Addresses_without_street_names "Addresses") (or map the belonging to a street with a relation using [associatedStreet relation](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Relation:associatedStreet "Relation:associatedStreet") or [street relation](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Relation:street "Relation:street").)

[![Wien Lainzer Str 8a.jpg](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/100px-Wien_Lainzer_Str_8a.jpg)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/File:Wien_Lainzer_Str_8a.jpg)

 This is sometimes used in some countries like England instead of (or in addition to) a house number.

This special kind of housenumber relates to a settlement instead of a street. Conscription numbers were introduced in the Austrio-Hungarian Empire and are still in use in some parts of Europe, sometimes together with street-related housenumbers which are also called *orientation numbers*.

[![Konskriptionsnummer.jpg](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/100px-Konskriptionsnummer.jpg)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/File:Konskriptionsnummer.jpg)

[addr:street](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:addr:street "Key:addr:street")

user defined

[![node](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_node.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Node "node") [![area](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_area.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Area "area")

The name of the respective street.
A way with `highway=*` or a square with `place=square` and the corresponding name should be found nearby. The belonging to a street can alternatively be represented by a [associatedStreet relation](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Relation:associatedStreet "Relation:associatedStreet") or [street relation](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Relation:street "Relation:street"). The keys `addr:housenumber=*` and `addr:street=*` in principle are the only necessary ones if there are valid border polygons. If you are not sure if it is so, just add `addr:city=*`, `addr:postcode=*` and `addr:country=*`.

[![Kirkland, WA - double street sign.jpg](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/100px-Kirkland,_WA_-_double_street_sign.jpg)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/File:Kirkland,_WA_-_double_street_sign.jpg)

This is part of an address which refers to the name of some territorial zone (usually a `place=*` like island, square or very small village) instead of a street (`highway=*`). Should not be used together with `addr:street=*`.

[addr:postcode](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:addr:postcode "Key:addr:postcode")

user defined

[![node](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_node.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Node "node") [![area](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_area.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Area "area")

The [postal code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code "wikipedia:Postal code") of the building/area. Some mappers prefer to use `boundary=postal_code`

[addr:city](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:addr:city "Key:addr:city")

user defined

[![node](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_node.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Node "node") [![area](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_area.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Area "area")

May not be required if [boundary=administrative](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Tag:boundary%3Dadministrative "Tag:boundary=administrative") is used correctly. May or may not be a clone of `is_in:city=*` (in some places the city in the address corresponds to the post office that serves the area rather than the actual city, if any, in which the building is located)! The name of the city as given in postal addresses of the building/area.

[![Lillerod.jpg](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/100px-Lillerod.jpg)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/File:Lillerod.jpg)

[addr:country](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:addr:country "Key:addr:country")

user defined

[![node](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_node.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Node "node") [![area](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_area.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Area "area")

May not be required if [boundary=administrative](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Tag:boundary%3Dadministrative "Tag:boundary=administrative") is used correctly. The [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/en:ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) two letter country code in *upper case*.
 Example: "DE" for Germany, "CH" for Switzerland, "AT" for Austria, "FR" for France, "IT" for Italy.
 *Caveat: The ISO 3166-1 code for Great Britain is "**GB**" and not "UK".* See also: `is_in:country=*`

[addr:full](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:addr:full "Key:addr:full")

user defined

[![node](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_node.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Node "node") [![area](./Zh-hans_Map%20Features%20-%20OpenStreetMap%20Wiki_files/20px-Osm_element_area.svg.png)](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Area "area")

Use this for a full-text, often multi-line, address if you find the structured address fields unsuitable for denoting the address of this particular location. Examples: "Fifth house on the left after the village oak, Smalltown, Smallcountry", or addresses using special delivery names or codes (possibly via an unrelated city name and post code), or PO Boxes.
 *Beware that these strings can hardly be parsed by software: "1200 West Sunset Boulevard Suite 110A" is still better represented as `addr:housenumber=1200` + `addr:street=West Sunset Boulevard` + `addr:flats=Suite 110A`.*
